name: OpenVPN
description: Learn how to connect to a virtual private network using OpenVPN.

name: Welcome
description: Learn how to use a TryHackMe room to start your upskilling in cyber security.

name: Intro to Researching
description: A brief introduction to research skills for pentesting.

name: Linux Fundamentals 1
description: Embark on the journey of learning the fundamentals of Linux. Learn to run some of the first essential commands on an interactive terminal.

name: Linux Fundamentals 2
description: Embark on the journey of learning the fundamentals of Linux. Learn to run some of the first essential commands on an interactive terminal.

name: Linux Fundamentals 3
description: Embark on the journey of learning the fundamentals of Linux. Learn to run some of the first essential commands on an interactive terminal.

name: Pentesting fundamentals
description: Fundamentals of penetration testing.

name: Principles of security
description: Principles of security.

name: Red Team Engagements
description: Intro to red team engagements.

name: Hip Flask
description: An in-depth walkthrough covering pentest methodology against a vulnerable server.

name: Google Dorking
description: Explaining how Search Engines work and leveraging them into finding hidden content!

name: Osint
description: Intro to Open Source Intelligence.

name: Shodan.io
description: Learn about Shodan.io and how to use it for device enumeration.

name: Tmux
description: Learn to use tmux, one of the most powerful multi-tasking tools on linux.

name: Nmap
description: Get experience with Nmap, a powerful network scanning tool.

name: Web Scanning
description: Learn the basics of automated web scanning.

name: Sublist3r
description: Learn how to find subdomains with Sublist3r.

name: Metasploit
description: An introduction to the main components of the Metasploit Framework.

name: Hydra
description: Learn about and use Hydra, a fast network logon cracker, to bruteforce and obtain a website's credentials.

name: Linux Privesc
description: Practice your Linux Privilege Escalation skills on an intentionally misconfigured Debian VM with multiple ways to get root! SSH is available.

name: Red Team Fundamentals
description: Learn about the basics of a red engagement, the main components and stakeholders involved, and how red teaming differs from other cyber security engagements.

name: Red Team Recon
description: Learn how to use DNS, advanced searching, Recon-ng, and Maltego to collect information about your target.

name: Vulnversity
description: Learn about active recon, web app attacks and privilege escalation.

name: Blue
description: Deploy & hack into a Windows machine, leveraging common misconfigurations issues.

name: Simple CTF
description: Beginner level CTF.

name: Bounty Hacker
description: A space cowboy-themed boot to root machine.

name: Crack the hash
description: Cracking hash challenges.

name: Agent Sudo
description: You found a secret server located under the deep sea. Your task is to hack inside the server and reveal the truth.

name: The Cod Caper
description: A guided room taking you through infiltrating and exploiting a Linux system.

name: Ice
description: Deploy & hack into a Windows machine, exploiting a very poorly secured media server.

name: Lazy Admin
description: Easy linux machine to practice your skills.

name: Basic Pentesting
description: This is a machine that allows you to practice web app hacking and privilege escalation.

name: OWASP top 10
description: Learn about and exploit each of the OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities; the 10 most critical web security risks.

name: Inclusion
description: A beginner-level LFI challenge.

name: Injection
description: Walkthrough of OS Command Injection. Demonstrate OS Command Injection and explain how to prevent it on your servers.

name: Juiceshop
description: This room uses the OWASP juice shop vulnerable web application to learn how to identify and exploit common web application vulnerabilities.

name: Overpass
description: What happens when some broke CompSci students make a password manager.

name: Year of the Rabbit
description: Can you hack into the Year of the Rabbit box without falling down a hole.

name: DevelPy
description: Boot2root machine for FIT and bsides Guatemala CTF.

name: Jack of all trades
description: Boot-to-root originally designed for Securi-Tay 2020.

name: Bolt
description: Bolt themed machine to root into.

name: Intro to x86 64
description: This room teaches the basics of x86-64 assembly language.

name: CC Ghidra
description: This room teaches the basics of ghidra.

name: CC Radare2
description: This room teaches the basics of radare2.

name: Reverse Engineering
description: This room focuses on teaching the basics of assembly through reverse engineering.

name: Reversing ELF
description: Room for beginner Reverse Engineering CTF players.

name: Dumping Router Firmware
description: Reverse engineering router firmware.

name: Intro to pwntools
description: Introduction to popular pwn tools framework.

name: Pwnkit: CVE-2021-4034
description: Interactive lab for exploiting and remediating Pwnkit (CVE-2021-4034) in the Polkit package.

description: A tutorial room exploring CVE-2019-14287 in the Unix Sudo Program. Room One in the SudoVulns Series.

name: Sudo Buffer Overflow
description: A tutorial room exploring CVE-2019-18634 in the Unix Sudo Program. Room Two in the SudoVulns Series.

name: Windows Privesc Arena
description: Students will learn how to escalate privileges using a very vulnerable Windows 7 VM.

description: Students will learn how to escalate privileges using a very vulnerable Linux VM.

name: Windows Privesc
description: Students will learn how to escalate privileges using a very vulnerable Windows 7 VM.

description: Metasploit Framework to get a foothold.

name: Ignite
description: A new start-up has a few security issues with its web server.

description: Walkthrough on exploiting a Linux machine. Enumerate Samba for shares, manipulate a vulnerable version of proftpd and escalate your privileges with path variable manipulation.

description: Another beginner-level CTF challenge.

description: Rick and Morty themed LFI challenge.

description: I made a website where you can look at pictures of dogs and/or cats! Exploit a PHP application via LFI and break out of a docker container.
